clinical_study.brief_title: Psychosocial Factors Affecting Glycemic Control in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Psychosocial and Socioeconomic Factors Affecting Glycemic Control in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to research psychosocial and socioeconomic factors among families that might affect glycemic control in children and adolescent with type 1 diabetes mellitus. These factors might be: living conditions, structure of the family, socioeconomic status, divorces and parent's own glycemic control status (if parent's type 1 diabetes mellitus is present in the family).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is going to clarify if there are some socioeconomical or psychosocial factors that might influence child's type 1 diabetes mellitus glycemic control. Study population consists of 300-350 diabetic children aged 1-16 years who have diabetic controls at Tampere University Hospital and their families. Required information is going to be collected with 2 questionnaires, wich families are kindly asked to fill in.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Socioeconomic and psychosocial factors affecting in type 1 diabetes glycemic status in children

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Possible parent's own type 1 diabetes glycemic status correlation with a child's type 1 diabetes glycemic control

arm_group.arm_group_label: Diabetic children aged 1-16 years and their families
arm_group.description: Diabetic children aged 1-16 years and their families. A child's disease duration must be over 1 year so that possible remission period is over.

study_pop.textblock: Type 1 diabetic children aged 1-16 years followed at Tampere University Hospital and their parents . Child's disease duration minimum 1 year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Type 1 diabetic children aged 1-16 years and their parents. Patient's and parents' willingness to participate
Exclusion Criteria: Type 1 diabetes duration under 1 year. Difficulties to understand written finnish.
